answers.answer: Debra:Some people, usuallly those with diabetes (though not alwyas) develop a thickened, yellowish patch on each shin.  The long Latin word you mention has to do with the appearance under the microscope.  If you or a member of your family has this, the most important thing is to check on whether there is also diabetes, and if so, whether it is under control.Best.Dr. R

question: WHAT IS THE DIAGNOCIS NECROBIOSIS LIPOIDICA MEAN AND WHAT EXACTLY CASUES IT?
title: SKIN RASH AND AREA WAS BIOSIPIED
